Class CartController

java.lang.Object
com.runtimerebels.store.controller.CartController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/carts") public class CartController extends Object
REST controller that exposes endpoints for managing shopping carts.

This controller allows clients to create, read, update, and delete items within a user's cart using a CartRepository.

Since:
11-19-2025
Author:
Henry Locke, Alexander Nima

  • Method Details

    • getAllCarts

      @GetMapping public List<Cart> getAllCarts()
      Retrives all carts in the system.
      Returns:
      a list of all Cart instances

    • getCart

      @GetMapping("/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Cart> getCart(@PathVariable String userId)
      Retrives the cart for a specific user.

      If a cart does not exist for the given user ID, a new empty cart instance is created and returned (but not persisted).

      The method also ensures that the internal lists for product IDs, quantities, and prices all have the same length.

      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of the user whose cart is requested
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the user's Cart and an HTTP 200 (OK) status

    • addToCart

      @PostMapping("/add") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Cart> addToCart(@RequestParam String userId, @RequestParam String productId, @RequestParam(defaultValue="1") int quantity, @RequestParam BigDecimal totalPrice)
      Adds a product to a user's cart or updates the quantity and price if a product is already present.

      If no car exists for the given user ID, a new cart is created. Input is validated so that quantity must be greater than zero and totalPrice must be positive.

      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of the user who owns the cart
      productId - the unique identifier of the product to add or update
      quantity - the quantity of the product to add (defaults to 1 if not provided)
      totalPrice - the total price for this cart line item
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated Cart and an HTTP 200 (OK) status if successful, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) if the input is invalid

    • updateCart

      @PutMapping("/update") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Cart> updateCart(@RequestParam String userId, @RequestParam String productId, @RequestParam int quantity)
      Updates the quantity of a specific product in a user's cart.

      If the quantity is set to zero, the product is removed from the cart. A negative quantity is rejected as invalid.

      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of the user who owns the cart
      productId - the unique identifier of the product to update
      quantity - the new quantity for the product (must be zero or positive)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated Cart and an HTTP 200 (OK) status if successful, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the car does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) if the product is not in the cart or the quantity is negative

    • removeItem

      @DeleteMapping("/remove") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Cart> removeItem(@RequestParam String userId, @RequestParam String productId)
      Removes a specific product from a user's cart.
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of the user who owns the cart
      productId - the unique identifier of th eproduct to remove
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated Cart and an HTTP 200 (OK) status if successful, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the cart does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) if the product is not present in the cart
